page.title: 17Shopping in Scarborough
page.content: There have been many developments and changes to the shopping facilities over the past ten years. The main street and town centre is now dominated by banks, building societies shoe shops and large multiples like Marks and Spencer. Local shops have tended to move to the side streets. The increasing traffic, especially in the height of the summer season, makes parking difficult near the town centre, and the recent change in the flow of traffic because of the new pedestrian precinct has not improved this problem. There is one large multi-storey car park but it is difficult to get out of on busy days. Local people tend to get very flustered and annoyed in the middle of the summer season as the town is so crowded it is difficult to do any quick shopping.
